paired.title: Paired
paired.msg: PushTrackers are paired but not connected. Please connect your PushTracker by pressing and releasing the right button. If you are unable to successfully connect, you may need to re-pair your PushTracker to your phone by using the PushTracker's settings menu.

disconnected.title: Disconnected
disconnected.msg: PushTrackers are paired but not connected. Please connect your PushTracker by pressing and releasing the right button. If you are unable to successfully connect, you may need to re-pair your PushTracker to your phone by using the PushTracker's settings menu.

connecting.title: Connecting
connecting.msg: PushTrackers are connecting / connected, but no version information has been received. You may have to disconnect and reconnect your PushTracker to get the version information.

unknown.title: No Known PushTrackers
unknown.msg: No PushTrackers have been paired or connected so far. Please pair your PushTracker by going into the PushTracker's settings menu.

eval-entry.fatigue-question: Do you have fatigue from pushing?
eval-entry.years-question: How many years have you been in a manual chair?

chair-type.question: What type is your manual wheelchair?
chair-type.label: Chair Type

training.Label: Powering SmartDrive
Bullets: Press back on the rocker switch to power on the SmartDrive, and forward to power off.
The SmartDrive attaches to the chair by aligning the flats in the clamp with the receiving slots on the SmartDrive
After aligning the SmartDrive and the flats, lower the SmartDrive over the clamp rods and rotate the SmartDrive downward to pivotally attach the SmartDrive to the clamp and thus the wheelchair.
In this position, the SmartDrive's weight rests on the ground.
To detach the SmartDrive from the chair, lift with the handle to disengage the SmartDrive from the clamp - the reverse of the attachment procedure.

training.Label: SmartDrive On/Off
Bullets: A red light will illuminate upon successful tap.

training.Label: Powering PushTracker
Bullets: Press either button on the PushTracker to power on.
Press and hold the left raised button for 3 seconds to enter sleep mode 'zzz' and power off the PushTracker.

training.Label: Tap Gesture
Bullets: Keeping your wrist straight, make contact on the push-rim with the palm of your hand.
A red light will illuminate upon successful tap.
Tip: You do not need to make contact with the PushTracker band.
Tip: Avoid moving your hand in a 'fishtail' like motion. This will lead to inconsistent tap recognition.

training.Label: Starting & Setting Speed
Bullets: Double-tap to initiate the SmartDrive. It will then begin to accelerate.
Then, single-tap to set your desired speed.
To increase speed, give a faster push and then single tap to set your desired speed.
If you do not tap, the SmartDrive will accelerate to the maximum speed controlled by the PushTracker's Max Speed setting.

training.Label: Stopping
Bullets: Double-tap to disengage the SmartDrive.
Then coast and brake with your hands.
Tip: To stop quickly, perform a single-tap followed by a quick combined tap and grab.
Note: Disengaging the SmartDrive only stops the SmartDrive motor, you will still need to brake with your hands to bring your chair to a stop.

training.Label: Steering
Bullets: To steer, gently grip the push-rim of the direction you want to go.
Light grip will allow you to veer.
Allow the push-rim to slide through your hands.

training.Label: Turning
Bullets: To turn, firmly grip the push-rim of the direction you want to go.
Firm grip will allow you to turn.
The tighter you grip, the sharper you will turn.
Tip: An optimal center of gravity position of the rear wheels will reduce the grip needed to make sharp turns.
Note: You may need to disengage the SmartDrive when you wish to make very sharp turns.

training_component.swipe-left-message: Swipe left to view more slides.

pairing.Label: Pairing Your PushTracker to Smart Evaluation App
Bullets: Press and hold the right flat button on your PushTracker for three seconds to enter the settings menu
Press the right button to scroll to the phone/PT icon.
Press the left raised button to initiate pairing.
Note: On some Android devices, while pairing, you might receive a message about an 'Incorrect Pin or Passkey'. As long as the PushTracker shows that it's connected you can ignore this.

pairing.Label: Connecting your PushTracker to Smart Evaluation App
Bullets: With the Smart Evaluation app open, press the right flat button on the PushTracker
You will see a 'Success' notification in the Smart Evaluation app.
Note: if you don't see a 'Success' notification in the Smart Evaluation app then you may need to re-pair your PushTracker

pairing.Label: Pairing Your PushTracker to Your SmartDrive
Bullets: Make sure there aren't any other SmartDrives in the vicinity when doing this!
For a PushTracker that has not been paired to a SmartDrive, press the left button and you will immediately see the PT (Bt symobol) SD icon.
Then press the left button again to initiate pairing.
You will see a checkmark on the PushTracker when successful
For a PushTracker that needs to be re-paired to any SmartDrive:
Press and hold the right flat button on your PushTracker for three seconds to enter the settings menu
Press the right button to scroll to the PT-SD icon.
Press the left raised button to initiate pairing your PushTracker to your SmartDrive.

trial.select-options: Select options and settings for SmartDrive trial.

trial.recommendation: Note: trials are recommended to contain ramps, multiple surface types, and should last at least a few minutes or 100 yards / 100 meters.
trial.evaluator-range: Note: the PushTracker does not need to stay connected to the phone throughout this phase - it only needs to connect at the start and end.
trial.smartdrive-connection: Note: before starting this trial, make sure you have the PushTracker and SmartDrive connected / 'SD On' to ensure that the PushTracker has the latest distance information.
trial.phase-1-desc: Go through the trial course with the SmartDrive - press start to begin.
trial.phase-2-desc: Now redo the same trial course without the SmartDrive - press start to begin.
trial.push_accuracy_disclaimer: The push tracker uses movement to detect pushes. This can cause a varying degree of accuracy depending on how the user wears and moves with the push tracker. A better metric for evaluation is the relative difference between the pushes with the SmartDrive and without the SmartDrive.
trial.connect_pushtracker_more_info: A PushTracker must be connected to the Smart Evaluation app in order to communicate. Please see the Connectivity section on the home screen or press the connectivity icon in the upper right.

faqs.question: Why isn't my SmartDrive engaging?
faqs.answer: Generally, you should check these things: 1) that your SmartDrive is powered on, 2) that your PushTracker is in 'SD On' mode - the blue light should be flashing, and 3) that you are in MX2+ mode - in which a double tap will engage the motor.

faqs.question: Can my SmartDrive slow me down?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, no - the SmartDrive is incapable of providing any braking for your chair. This means that after you turn off the motor you will need to manually grab the hand-rims and bring your chair to a stop.  This also means that your SmartDrive cannot slow you down going down a ramp or a hill.

faqs.question: Do I need to re-pair my PushTracker to my SmartDrive?
faqs.answer: No, the only time you need to re-pair your PushTracker to your SmartDrive is after performing an over-the-air (OTA) update. After doing that, the PushTracker will automatically go into pairing mode when you try to connect or turn 'SD On'.

faqs.question: Why won't my PushTracker connect to my phone?
faqs.answer: If you are using Android then it might be because the phone has saved the pairing information - which will prevent the PushTracker from establishing a solid connection.  To fix this, simply open your phone's Bluetooth settings menu and click 'Forget' on the PushTracker that shows up in that menu.  Once you have done that, restart the Smart Evaluation app and the PushTracker should be able to reliably connect - without needing to re-pair to the phone!

faqs.question: How can I make the SmartDrive safe for children?
faqs.answer: The SmartDrive is safe for children to use - but we do recommend the best way to ensure safety is to train them on proper tapping and braking techniques. Moreover, we have included the ability to limit the max speed of the SmartDrive (from 0.5 miles per hour all the way up to 5.5 miles per hour) as well as the acceleration of the SmartDrive. For someone who is just learning to push or to use a SmartDrive, we recommend setting both very low.

faqs.question: Why should I want a SmartDrive?
faqs.answer: You should be active and go out into the world! With pushing however, unlike the general advice with walking (where people really cannot walk too much) - people CAN push too much! If you push too much then you will be more likely to get pain and injury in your arms and shoulders - which may limit your mobility and independence.  With the SmartDrive you are still able to push around in your chair as you normally would - you can now go farther faster and with less effort! Use it when you need to get somewhere fast or up a big hill - don't kill your shoulders if you don't have to! Enjoy your journey with your SmartDrive!

faqs.question: PushTracker App and Smart Evaluation App
faqs.answer: If you have both the PushTracker and Smart Evaluation apps on your phone, you should ensure that only the one you want to connect the PushTracker to is running - otherwise the PushTracker might connect to the other app than the one you intend!

ota.title: Firmware Updates
ota.check_new_firmware_message: Do you want to check and download new firmware?
ota.check_firmware_error: An error occurred downloading the latest firmware. Try again, if the issue continues please report feedback.
ota.downloading: Fetching latest firmware data from the server

starting.title: Starting OTA
starting.message: Warning: you should not leave this page while you are performing OTA firmware updates of the SmartDrive or PushTracker. If you leave this page or kill the app, the OTAs will be cancelled or may fail.

leaving.title: Warning
leaving.message: Warning: you are leaving the OTA page during an OTA - this will cancel all ongoing OTAs! Are you sure you want to leave?

multiple-devices.title: Multiple Devices
multiple-devices.message: Warning: It is recommended to perform an OTA on one device at a time. Please allow a device to complete updating before starting any additional OTAs.

sd_connection.title: SmartDrive connection error!
sd_connection.message: Bad connection with SmartDrive, please power-cycle the SmartDrive with address:

bluetooth.sd_app_conn_instructions: For the Smart Evaluation app to be able to see and connect to a SmartDrive, you must have the SmartDrive ON and power assist OFF / 'SD Off'.  If you have trouble, turn the SmartDrive OFF and then ON.
bluetooth.pt_app_conn_instructions: To connect the PushTracker to the Smart Evaluation app, you must have the app open on your phone, then press and release the right button on the PushTracker. This will either connect your PushTracker to your app or take you into the pairing settings of the PushTracker. After pairing, you will need to leave the settings menu and then press the right button to connect to the app. If you have trouble, put the PushTracker to SLEEP and then turn it ON.
bluetooth.enable-bluetooth: Smart Evaluation has detected that Bluetooth is not enabled on your device. Please enable Bluetooth to perform OTAs and perform evaluations.

not-found: We were unable to find the description for the latest firmware!
1.6: PushTracker can now receive push detection settings from the smartphone app.
PushTracker now sends current push detection settings on app connection initialization.
Adjusted default push detection settings on the PushTracker.
PushTracker now shows a checkmark during phone connection indication if it successfully connects or is already connected to the phone when the user initiates the connection.
1.5: Updated company logo branding when booting PushTracker from sleep.
Now show estimated drive range on the PushTracker in DisplayInfo  battery status screen.
Now show OTA status bar and percentage on PushTracker when performing PushTracker OTA.
When the SD is not paired (e.g. after OTA) and the left button is pressed to turn 'SD On', the PushTracker goes directly into pairing to SD mode.
When the PushTracker is not paired to the phone (e.g. after OTA) and the right button is pressed to connect to the phone, the PushTracker goes directly into pairing to phone mode.
Bugfixes to the pairing process for handling multiple devices.
1.4: Addition of 'EZ-ON' mode for PushTracker - you can now turn power assist ON & OFF / 'SD On' & 'SD Off' by tapping!
1.3: Addition of 'EZ-ON' mode for PushTracker - you can now turn power assist ON & OFF / 'SD On' & 'SD Off' by tapping!
1.2: Added 'About' to PushTracker 'Settings' menu which shows the firmware versions of the PushTracker, SmartDrive Bluetooth (BLE) and SmartDrive Microcontroller (MCU). Also shows the most recent error code and information.
